title: @Riot: Is Ezreal Part of the "Marksman Update"? (+Analysis/Discussion)

body:
If so, I would really like to provide some input/feedback if that be k. I've thought about what i'd change about Ez since I bought him a few years prior (edit: actually he was the very first champion I bought and mained AND got a penta with o 3o, just realised), and after hundreds of games both as AD and AP throughout the seasons, i've come to the following conclusion (which has stayed true for at least the past year or so):

Ezreal has three main issues imo. Basic waveclear, weak late-game scaling, and almost no real utility. His kit in general is fine though imo, with it's defining weakness being low waveclear outside of his ultimate which I think they should keep since removing every weakness on a champion is a pretty dumb idea. Now the other two issues can be touched on somewhat to help him out a little -

**//=====The Late-Game=========================================//**

His early and mid-game is decent enough with TF/LB power-spike occuring during that period, it's just that later on in the game he drops off HARD mainly due to not really having much kit-based scaling like other marksmen (his passive aids a little, so I wouldn't want that changed tbh even as AP it helps shred turrets). What I mean by this is that other ADCs usually have something for the late-game that keeps their kits relevant throughout the length of a match. Examples (not exhaustive) - 

- more spammable _magic_ damage AOE poke, like Kog and Corki, making their actual kit/abilities harder to mitigate while building AD, which despite Ez having a hybrid kit - it's confined to a burst pattern hence AP Ez with higher R ratios making sense
- %HP/true damage - like Vayne/Varus/Kog/etc.
- better on-hit scaling/on-demand steroids - like Lucian/Draaaven/Trist
- utility/CC/resets/other defensive - Trist/Cait/Ashe/MF/Sivir/Kalista/Urgot
- easier waveclear - Graves, and probably 2/3rds of the above mentioned ADCs

Some ADCs have several of these aspects (Jinx), all which keep their kits relevant into the late-game in conjunction with their expected crit-based DPS via items. And yes, they still have weaknesses which are exploitable but much clearer and tangible strengths too. Meanwhile, Ez has a global magic damage ult with a huge drop-off which can't clear a single wave without leaving stragglers unless you go full AP, and physical damage poke which is easier to mitigate, and ok escape/cooldowns (more dashes/resets since his release doesn't make him as the go to "safe" pick as he used to be - but safe!=relevant if he has no presence late and his entire team is dead whilst he pokes from behind nexus pointlessly as is very common for a losing Ez). If his Q did magic (but remain on-hit like Nid), I think he would be better off - could be an interesting experiment to swap out damage types. However, despite all this I think Ez is still fine early-mid, he just needs a little help for that late game relevance.

**//=====So What To Change?=====================================//**

Only skill that needs an update (and not by much either) would be his W, which has been stripped down a lot mechanically already so may as well replace one of it's functions without altering the playstyle just supplementing it. How? Well, retain everything about it stat-wise from cooldown/mana/magic damage/champion only, but play on the actual Essence _Flux_ aspect. I.e. remove the AS buff to allies (since that's pretty much the remains of an older ability) and replace it with another shifting variable. Something that would effect only his late-game but leave his early-mid game relatively untouched. In other words, W either - 

A. Shift allies/enemies percent (not flat which helps early) Armor/MR values _OR_
B. Mark the targets to reveal them and deal a % of their HP on-hit for the duration of the mark

These changes would provide a tiny bit of utility and have little effect to his early game but a lot more to his late game where he currently drops off thus evening out his power-curve and keeping it up to par with other marksmen.

It's a pretty logical solution tbh that would help out Ez without overdoing it or really changing the way he currently plays/is built. The other option, is to try out the damage type swap mentioned earlier - which coincidentally aligns with what happened with Runeglaive but without the waveclear effect which could make this option more balanced. There's also the potential to reduce Q's base damage but allow it to crit in exchange, however that idea seems to generate a kneejerk negative reaction and one I don't favor much either since it would require offsetting his already reliable early game with unnecessary changes even if it is more late-game oriented it would be too disruptive and much harder to balance fairly. Yup, lots of time to think about this. xP

Thoughts?

**TL;DR** - If you could change one thing about Ezreal (but keeping him within power-budget), what would it be? Do you think he's overdue for a Power-Up⇧?

Image by catmushrooms, thought it looked cool. Worth checking out his other artwork imo.

replies.body:
Ezreal is unlikely to be a key recipient of changes in the marksman update. We threw some ideas around for him but never really settled on something we liked enough.

It's quite possible he benefits from other pre-season changes quite well, though.

If I recall correctly, {{item:3508}} [Essence Reaver](http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Essence_Reaver) was mentioned as one of the items that are up for rework within the big marksman update in the preseason.
Is it possible that _this_ is the change Ezreal is supposed to benefit from?
no
no intention of bringing ap ez back? remember that he was designed to be both ap and ad

I know it's kinda off topic but...

Will Varus be looked at at too? or he is going to be ignored as always?

> [{quoted}](name=RiotRepertoir,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=sVlwJLKp,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2015-09-23T17:03:57.761+0000)
>
> Ezreal is unlikely to be a key recipient of changes in the marksman update. We threw some ideas around for him but never really settled on something we liked enough.
> 
> It's quite possible he benefits from other pre-season changes quite well, though.

Knew it, Caster Marksman getting buffs.

Hey RiotRepertoir, thanks for the response. I can see how that would turn out. However, would you guys potentially consider putting something like the above which requires not much implementation or art assets as a stopgap measure till you guys settle on a better, more long-term solution? You know, to tide us over till then?

Also, could you give us some idea of what exactly you are looking to do with his kit, is it a specific ability (W) or is it something more holistic that you guys want to do like a full on rework down the line? Just so we can better understand the complexities and scope involved and possibly offer some further ideas if you can help to narrow down the criteria.

Hey RiotRepertoir, what about a visual rework? Ezrael seems like he'd be a prime candidate to get something like a Kassadin VU, where his model and animations are modernized to better reflect the character.

What were the ideas for him concerning his W?

And personally, what do you think his W needs to make AD Ezreal feels rewarded when he uses it?

And please, don't give it an AD ratio and call it a day :/

I LOVE the idea of W marking targets. They could make it like "Targets marked by essence flux have their armor and MR reduced by x% for y seconds". They could even make the percentage stack from Q hits which fits very well with his playstyle. The Armor/MR pen will help Ezreal's hybrid kit be much better late game  and not need both LW and VS

> [{quoted}](name=relevantex,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=sVlwJLKp,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2015-09-23T16:38:10.444+0000)
>
> I LOVE the idea of W marking targets. They could make it like "Targets marked by essence flux have their armor and MR reduced by x% for y seconds". They could even make the percentage stack from Q hits which fits very well with his playstyle. The Armor/MR pen will help Ezreal's hybrid kit be much better late game  and not need both LW and VS

I love the idea of W leaving a mark. Just because there is so many options. 

Another could be if ezreal lands w and marks a enemy his passive wouldnt start ticking until the mark is done. With this to keep it balanced the mark duration would be flat rated so both mid and adc ezreal could remain the same.

You know it didn't occur to me to combine the two solutions in that way, lol. Was more concerned with identifying why and where we could change his kit, than overly the how. You're right though, there could be several variants possible whilst potentially drawing out his explorer theme.

Also, a mark does sort of make sense considering his Q procs on-hits so it would synergise well with his kit e.g. mark with W through wave, follow up with well-aimed Q snipe in time and get rewarded for it somehow (either via some conditional utility or damage). So many possibilities. It's fun.
Ezreal in this pic be like "I CAME"

...

10/10 feedback lol. I did ask for it though I guess. Never thought of the image in that way though xp. Cannot.. unsee.. Dx

Jokes aside, I think a little self-heal when E'ing through your W would be quite nice for him. Sacrifice mana for health, a nice trade off.

The numbers could be like: 50/75/100/125/150 + 40% Bonus AD and it only applies to himself.

Doing this cost him up to 140/150/160/170/180 Mana and it costs him his only escape, which is very dangerous for Ezreal.

Thoughts?

Idk, I feel like it's too much effort/wasted resources just to heal himself (2 spells + 1 escape) that he could probably get from lifestealing anyway so he doesn't really _need_ it. Also Kindreds healing passive doesn't even need to use up a single spell to get nearly the same effect, but that's apples to oranges and suits them better than it would Ez.

I guess it doesn't really do much to help him other than give him a bit of sustain if he's feeling wasteful/bored. He wouldn't really do it in-combat unless he was burning alive at low HP but chances of that late game are pretty low (also he'd be oom in two rotations if he tried that during laning). If he's targeted and gets that low without having already used E, then that Ez has bigger problems that no buff can fix cuz that is one dumbass Ez. I mean.. err.. I like your other suggestion for an adaptable Q better, would be a lot more useful in a game.
Plus giving innate sustain to an adc outside of lifesteal always runs a risky path imo, even one as situational and costly as that.

I think it would help Ezreal's frustration with dueling in a minion wave if W marked all minions.  Every minion marked will allow his Q to pass through it.  That was if you are dueling a champion in a creep wave, you can shoot your W at them, and that will create a "path" that you can aim your Q through.
I really like this a lot.

I think it'd be neat if they found a way for him to work differently depending on how you built him maybe bonus effects via an ad build/ap build.  I gotta head to work but as a frequent ezreal player id love to read through this thread when I get back tonight

One of the things I remember reading about a while ago when some people were asking for some updates to Ezreal's kit was the fact that he's the Prodigal Explorer.... and yet his kit has nothing to do with his actual job. Sure, you can scout bushes with his abilities, but that's only really doable with Mystic Shot because of it's range.

Having Essence Flux reveal hit targets sounds like an interesting step in that direction.

What you say is true. That way, he can also finally stand with the other 2 main Trinity Force ADCs (Kog, Corki) in also having a reveal - and both of whom are consistently picked on the competitive stage. Ezreal wants in. It's his time to shine again, dammit. Wait a sec, his ult already scouts... albeit once every 80 seconds. I know, it's not the same. ._.

Good post. Some would say enlightening. xp
Anyone got any feedback? Good? Bad? Who cares he's too pretty? :c
He IS very pretty...

Hmm, browsing through the other comments here and the ideas I'm getting from them is perhaps his W could become a resistance shred/buff?
Another idea on that is making it so it marks targets it passes through so Q can pierce through them.
Tho that second idea could break Ez since one of his bigger weakness is lack of waveclear.

I really like where Ez's W is at, but you could add 10% to the attack speed and add another second to the buff so it matches his passive buff duration.  Ez can get +90% attack speed if he E's into his W and already has 4 stacks on his passive.  That is some serious burst attack speed and fast tower clear.

The issue with Ezreal is that he has long range, strong poke with a great escape. If you make him too strong in a direct fight he becomes an unassailable wall that beats you both up close and at a distance. If he gets any buffs, it needs to be something that doesn't help him win a fight.

maybe you can add something like cassiopiea where she gains stacks from hitting enemies with her abilities. You can make it where ezreal gains differnt or more abilities depending on how many Q's he's landed or how much damage in total he's done with those Q's, Riot can even take away ezreal's current passive and make it where all his abilities can be buffed over the course of the game through these stacks.

So ezreal might gain some true damage on his Q's or auto attacks when he gets enough stacks, he might gain aoe on his Q or a mutiple of different things he can gain. Since ezreal seems to generally be an early game marksmen you can make taking towers give a lot of stacks and then ezreal will have a strong early game but might fall off or be less useful then other adc's if he ezreal's team doesn't take towers and objectives early. Riot can also make ezreal kills and assists give stacks but deaths lose stacks. Or make ezreal sort of like the old Blood thirster where unit kills gives some base stats but he loses some of those stacks on death. I just feel there's a lot of things ezreal can gain that are interesting in a system like this.

Another way is to make ezreal do more damage against people who buy lots of armor so hitting Q's on tanks isn't completely useless. I don't know about now but in the past first picking ezreal was asking the enemy team to pick 4 tanks and this was before tanks and bruisers got buffed. So something like 20% extra armor pene and some true damage gained around ezreals triforce/muramana power spike might be a good thing.

I just feel like there needs to be a way to make ezreal really strong in the mid game but also where he still falls of hard if you don't do anything with ezreals power spike. Like a passive that can't be used until the twenty minute mark but is amazing but over the course of the rest of the game the passive will deteriorate. This can give ezreal the opposite power spike the old tristinia had when she was strong early then weak mid game then strong late game.

Here's the thing though that I got to say. I don't think Ez needs a change all that much, if at all. You go on the fact that he's got weak end game and no real utility, but then you've got to think... That's not why you're choosing Ezreal. As you yourself have stated, not all champion need to be rid of all their weaknesses and Ez's has always been that he just doesn't work as well in the late game as other ADCs. You chose Ez because he's got a great early game, is among one of the safer ADC's to play thanks to his kit, and has is one of the few marksmen who isn't locked down into any one build that can be effective.

Buffing his late game or giving him too much utility would push him close to this 'I can do anything' homogenization that Riot has taken painful strides to move away from. Especially recently, the idea is to have a very set focus on what a character can do well and what they can't with making it so that when those situations arise, these characters can shine. An perfect example of this is Ashe. During the assassin meta, she wasn't all that desired, because most Assassins can catch her and burst her down with little effort and theres little she could do otherwise to stop it. Come the Cinderhulk tank era, though, and she's much more desired, capable of slowing down, stopping, and working against the tanks much better then some of the other adcs around. There are simply times and games that call for a more CC heavy ADC who works better late game like Ashe and others that call for someone who's more about early game and mid game as well as more reliable, like Ez.

This isn't to say that he should be useless come Late game, espeically if he's been feed hard throughout the game, but there's a steady balance between what is enough and what isn't. ATM, Ezreal is in a pretty solid spot and I'd rather not see the ADC meta shift back to where it was just him, Corki, and Lucian again.

Well this thought did cross my mind as I was typing some of the things you referenced, and I definitely wouldn't throw any CC or waveclear onto him or some huge sweeping rework to buff him into some one-stop wonder. I just feel even given his strengths his value as an ADC feels subpar late game in general, especially after Riot have put in so much effort to avoid early winning games.

Like if you flattened out the typical power curve for every ADC along with their unique traits contributing points or something, Ezreal would just about fall short of the total average value in the current game. Yes he has a decently reliable early/mid game, so do a lot of other marksmen who can manage to ride that wave into the late game (whether that wave goes up or down). (AD) Ez just sinks at some point, and it sucks. At least, that's how playing him comes across these days. Could just be the meta, who knows maybe the AD itemisation changes could swing the game back in his favor a little.

It's not just the fact that Ez has a reliable Early/Mid. It's the fact that thanks to his kit, he's able to spam his abilities more readily then anyone else and (In turn) has the best escapes out of any ADC when played well. You could have the best damage in the game but that doesn't matter if you can't live long in a fight, and Ez is the best of them to do just that. I admit that his scaling could be brought up a tad or so, but I don't think he's got the huge stone drop for end game unless said end game we're talking about is a 50 minute bout. 

That all said, itemization and Meta does a LOT to change up who's good and who's bad. Marksmen in general need an item face lift and I'm kinda surprised they weren't first in line, considering how bad their items have been compared to everyone else since day one. Meta also impacts ADC's a lot more then any other champion in the game, if only because it flat out decides what's more important to the team, the extra CC, the hyper carry, or the one who can be the most safe. Right now, with everyone crapping themselves silly at even the mere mention of a Juggernaut (Despite the nerfs ALL of them have received), and tanks still being relevant, CC is more desired then someone who can just run away.

I'll give you that he has a decent escape, even if we have since had champions like Lucian, Kalista, and now Kindred who may be able to out do him in that regard in more specific situations. Still, you mention his poke. But spammable physical damage poke that can only hit one target < spammable AOE magic damage poke for an **AD**C in the late game when every one's packing a decent amount of Armor whilst half the champions in the game could still be at base MR (which doesn't improve by much per lvl if at all if ranged). Which is one of the reasons why we've seen Corki played _a lot_ more regularly in constrast to Ez at higher brackets despite both being TF/poke-based marksmen. Harder to block/mitigate damage from a Corki than an AD Ez. I'm sure you've seen those moments where Ez is the last one remaining vs an enemy team and can't poke them off 3 turrets and an inhib despite supposedly specializing in poke simply because it's so much easier to ignore him at that point in the game.

I wouldn't add CC/waveclear to Ez, and you're right something else is still desired hence rather a boost to his damage/scaling as you also mentioned.

I never asked for true damage on Ez anywhere in my post... or specifically _maximum_ % of HP. Could end up being % current magic damage, idk, it's too far down the pipe to know for sure what would work best, they're merely logical suggestions post-analysis. Also didn't ask for CC, or wavecle... did you even read the post?!? Sorry, it's just I tried making the post flow as easily as I could (which i'm aware is not my forte since I like being thorough lol).
well im not arguing anything here but varus and kog do not have %hp true dmg, kog has flat true damage on his passive and only vayne out of adc's has %hp true dmg

Didn't say they did. It's a category of %HP OR true damage.. that's what the slash is for. Hence "%HP**/**true damage - like Vayne/Varus/Kog/etc." and assumed people would be able to figure out which one I was referring to with each, instead of requiring me to make up a table I went with a brief list to summarise lol.  All three have lower cooldown %HP damage, magic on Varus/Kog and true damage on Vayne. Plus the flat on Kog's passive I guess.
ah i see the / just made it seem you were referring to %hp true dmg

Right now Riot has said that Ezreal is in a decent place with the exception of his W. They've said most marksmen will be receiving a change to one or two of their abilities so Ezreal's W will likely be redesigned when the marksman update starts. The W was great when it stole attack speed and healed allies but now it just feels pointless except to maybe push towers with allies slightly faster.

I was hoping so too, but apparently they decided to not bother with finding out a means of making W useful. You could say at least they know W is weak, but they've known that for going on years now and still cba with it. Which is a shame 🔔🔔.

> [{quoted}](name=RiotRepertoir,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=5xifUFME,comment-id=000400000000,timestamp=2015-09-22T22:47:45.732+0000)
>
> I don't think Ezreal is receiving an update outside of maybe some tuning changes and/or stat adjustments. While we thought he could use some work (his W is especially lame), we didn't land on an idea that was fitting for him, and so we went with some other characters that we thought we had better directions on.

That's lame, especially since FeralPony said he'd really love to rework the W since it feels so lackluster now :/ I admit there are certain marksmen who need help more than Ezreal but I just want W to feel like it has a use lol
ez's problem is that he sucks but if you buff him he will be GOD, ever since they nerfed runeglave EZ still trash
